author: Staff Reporter
text:
Petitioners and their vehicles were frisked by the police personnel at the entrance of the Collectorate in Salem on Monday.— Photo: E. Lakshmi Narayanan

Following frequent self-immolation bids at the Collectorate entrance on Mondays, the city police have intensified frisking to prevent petitioners carrying kerosene-filled bottles or poison inside the premises.

During the weekly grievances redress meetings held at Collectorate on every Mondays, petitioners from across the district come to submit petitions.

However, if action was not taken by officials on the petitions or to draw the attention of the officials, a few petitioners attempt self immolation and also consume poison inside the meeting hall.

Though frisking is done by police officials, they enter the premises and attempt to end their lives. Hence, additional police personnel were posted and frisking intensified from Monday.

All the petitioners were subject to thorough check. The police personnel were present even on the road to prevent any self-immolation bids by petitioners.

On Monday, Menaka (30) along with her three children came to Collectorate with a kerosene can and tried to immolate herself. But the police prevented her.

She demanded action against her husband.

Also, Suresh Kumar of Kandampatti came to the Collectorate with a kerosene can and attempted self immolation. The police prevented it.

He wanted action against a person who cheated him to the tune of Rs. 2.5 lakh by promising job.
title: Checking intensified at Collectorate entrance
